Uses of Interface
tools.httpserver.HttpConstants

Packages that use HttpConstants
icap.services.resources.gs icap services specific resources 
tools.httpserver Basic HTTP / HTTPS server for Server administration.
Attention: this server is used for convenience in order to avoid the need of installing/configuring external server.
No security audit nor intrusion tests have been performed on it. 
tools.httpserver.custom Specific pages adaptation for GreasySpoon administration 
 

Uses of HttpConstants in icap.services.resources.gs
 

Classes in icap.services.resources.gs that implement HttpConstants
 class JavaSpoonScript
          Extension of GreasySpoon script, in order to support direct Java coding without JSR223 overhead
Scripts must conform to NativeScript skeleton and are compiled and loaded in memory Compiled result is stored on disk but is more or less useless TODO: check if scripts are correctly unloaded from memory after deletion TODO: check if writing compiled class on disk has an interest or working in memory can be enough
 class Jsr223SpoonScript
          GreasySpoon script, synchronized with a script file on disk
scripts are updated based on file time stamp provided by the OS
Scripts files must include following header:
==ServerScript==
@name Say Hello!
@status on/off => allow to enable/disable script (enabled by default)
@description Script description
@include regex matching url (i.e: http://www\.google\.com/.* ) and for which script is applied
@include other regexes
@exclude regex matching url (i.e: http://gmail\.google\.com/.* ) and for which script does not apply
==/ServerScript==

Optional supported headers are:
@order 0..n ==> allows to ask this script to be executed in n position
@responsecode 0|2xx|3xx|5xx..
 class SpoonScript
          GreasySpoon script, synchronized with a script file on disk
scripts are updated based on file timestamp provided by the OS
Scripts files must include following header:
==ServerScript==
@name Say Hello!
@status on/off => allow to enable/disable script (enabled by default)
@description Script description
@include regex matching url (i.e: http://www\.google\.com/.* ) and for which script is applied
@include other regexes
@exclude regex matching url (i.e: http://gmail\.google\.com/.* ) and for which script does not apply
==/ServerScript==

Optional supported headers are:
@order 0..n ==> allows to ask this script to be executed in n position
@responsecode 0|2xx|3xx|5xx..
 

Uses of HttpConstants in tools.httpserver
 

Classes in tools.httpserver that implement HttpConstants
 class FileEditor
          Provides facilities to edit and save text files stored on disk
Replace following html tags in page: <!-- comment --> \t replaced by server events (save, ...) <!-- error --> \t replaced by server errors %name% \t replaced by file name (without path) <!--filename-->\t replaced by file name (with path) <!--filecontent-->\t replaced by file content
 class HtmlFile
          Create an HTML page using file content stored onto disk.
 class HttpServer
          Create an HTTP(s) server that can be used for application administration.
 class User
          Simple user account class
 class UserSession
          Thread allowing to manage a connection between a user (web browser) and the http(s) server.
 class UserTransaction
          This class integrate methods to analyze HTTP message between a client (browser) and the http(s) server.
 

Uses of HttpConstants in tools.httpserver.custom
 

Classes in tools.httpserver.custom that implement HttpConstants
 class PageUsers
          HTML manipulation dedicated to GreasySpon service.
Generate HTML tags for GreasySpoon scripts list.
Replace <!--content--> tag by generated HMTL list.
 class RequestsManager
          HTTP server logic Manages custom operation on GET and POST requests
 class ScriptCheckerPage
          HTML manipulation dedicated to GreasySpon service.
Allows to display/edit script checker content.
 class ScriptList
          HTML manipulation dedicated to GreasySpon service.
Generate HTML tags for GreasySpoon scripts list.
Replace <!--content--> tag by generated HMTL list.
